About 12 years ago (before cobots were a thing), I saw a Kawada robot working in factories in Japan, doing many tasks the big robots wouldn't be able to do. TeslaBot could be close to that: https://t.co/relYs52geT

Goal is to design it (in public) and iterate on the design/learnings.

Some might find it useful and/or fun.

Thinking of putting together a public tech document, CAD, electronics, designs on how a #TeslaBot could be built:

-Compute (Nvidia AGX?)
-Stereo vision
-Depth sensors
-Actuators
-Harmonic drives
-Battery
-2D lidars
-Other sensors

& iterate in public. It could be fun. https://t.co/bpwUelL0ok

How would a DAO for automation & robotics look like?

Automation products & robots are owned by the DAO, profits from the robots go into the treasury & token holders?
